glsa.title: Multiple vulnerabilities in metamail
glsa.synopsis: Several format string bugs and buffer overflows were discovered in metamail, potentially allowing execution of arbitrary code remotely.

background.p: Metamail is a program that decodes MIME encoded mail. It is therefore often automatically called when an email is received or read.

description.p: Ulf Harnhammar found two format string bugs and two buffer overflow bugs in Metamail.

impact.p: A remote attacker could send a malicious email message and execute arbitrary code with the rights of the process calling the Metamail program.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All users of Metamail should upgrade to the latest stable version:
